creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
markings: LRC, on red seal: 吉隆之印 {Yoshitaka no in}
medium: Hanging scroll, ink and color on silk
signed: LRC, in black: 雪佳筆 {Sekka hitsu}
text: Kusunoki Masashige, a 14th-century warrior, is today seen as the epitome of samurai loyalty. In the Battle of Minato River 1336, he fought for the Emperor against the Ashikaga clan rebels. Kamisaka Sekka depicted him here in battle armor and surrounded by attendants preparing for the fight.
title: Kusunoki Masashige before the Battle at Minato River
